string-array.name: versions_array
string-array.item: 2.4|New work-around for JellyBean logcat reader (requires root)
2.4|New scale themes: white, yellow, orange and automatic
2.4|Fix long delays using auto-kill from widgets
2.4|Settings are updated when pressing home, not only with back button
2.3.4|Fix app restore/move failing with few apps
2.3.4|Fix FC in settings on some devices
2.3.3|Improve SD scan speed and shows file names too
2.3.2|New long-press log to copy to clipboard
2.3.1|Fix tweak screens possibly blank when switching apps
2.3.1|Fix sysctl not available on some devices
2.1|New widget and logcat text size options

string-array.name: build_presets_names
string-array.item: Improve screen on speed during calls

string-array.name: event_descriptions
string-array.item: The user has switched the phone into or out of Airplane Mode
The user pressed the Report button in the crash/ANR dialog
Used to indicate that some piece of data should be attached to some other place
This is a sticky broadcast containing the charging state, level, and other information about the battery
Indicates low battery condition on the device
Indicates the battery is now okay after being low
Show activity for reporting a bug
Perform a call to someone specified by the data
The user pressed the call button to go to the dialer or other appropriate UI for placing a call
Display an activity chooser, allowing the user to pick what they want to before proceeding
This is broadcast when a user action should request a temporary system dialog to dismiss
The current device Configuration (orientation, locale, etc) has changed
Delete the given data from its container
A sticky broadcast that indicates low memory condition on the device
Indicates low memory condition on the device no longer exists
Dial a number as specified by the data
A sticky broadcast for changes in the physical docking state of the device
Provide explicit editable access to the given data
Resources for a set of packages (which were previously unavailable) are currently available since the media on which they exist is available
Resources for a set of packages are currently unavailable since the media on which they exist is unavailable
Allow the user to select a particular kind of data and return it
An GTalk connection has been established
An GTalk connection has been disconnected
Wired Headset plugged in or unplugged
An input method has been changed
Insert an empty item into the given container
Pick an existing item, or insert a new item, and then edit it
Show settings for managing network data usage of a specific application
Indicates low memory condition notification acknowledged by user and package management should be started
External media was removed from SD card slot, but mount point was not unmounted
External media is present, and being disk-checked
User has expressed the desire to remove the external storage media
External media is present and mounted at its mount point
External media is present, but is using an incompatible file-system (or is blank)
The media scanner has finished scanning a directory
Request the media scanner to scan a file and add it to the media database
The media scanner has started scanning a directory
External media is unmounted because it is being shared via USB mass storage
External media is present but cannot be mounted
External media is present, but not mounted at its mount point
A new version of your application has been installed over an existing one
An outgoing call is about to be placed
A new application package has been installed on the device
An existing application package has been changed (e.g. a component has been enabled or disabled)
The user has cleared the data of a package
Sent to the installer package of an application when that application is first launched
An existing application package has been completely removed from the device
Sent to the system package verifier when a package needs to be verified
An existing application package has been removed from the device
A new version of an application package has been installed, replacing an existing version that was previously installed
The user has restarted a package, and all of its processes have been killed
Create a new item in the given container, initializing it from the current contents of the clipboard
Pick an item from the data, returning what was selected
Pick an activity given an intent, returning the class selected
External power has been connected to the device
External power has been removed from the device
Show power usage information to the user
Some content providers have parts of their namespace where they publish new events or items that the user may be especially interested in
Sent after the screen turns off
Sent after the screen turns on
Start action associated with long pressing on the search key
Deliver some data to someone else
Send a message to someone specific
Deliver multiple data to someone else
The current time has changed. Sent every minute
A user ID has been removed from the system
Sent when the user is present after device wakes up (e.g when the keyguard is gone)
Display the data to the user
The current system wallpaper has changed
Pick a Wi-Fi network to connect to
Broadcast intent action indicating that Wi-Fi has been enabled, disabled, enabling, disabling, or unknown
The network IDs of the configured networks could have changed
Broadcast intent action indicating that the state of Wi-Fi connectivity has changed
An access point scan has completed, and results are available from the supplicant
Broadcast intent action indicating that a connection to the supplicant has been established
Broadcast intent action indicating that the state of establishing a connection to an access point has changed
Intent used to broadcast the change in connection state of the local Bluetooth adapter to a profile of the remote device
The local Bluetooth adapter has finished the device discovery process
The local Bluetooth adapter has started the remote device discovery process
The local Bluetooth adapter has changed its friendly Bluetooth name
Show a system activity that requests discoverable mode
Show a system activity that allows the user to turn on Bluetooth
Indicates the Bluetooth scan mode of the local Adapter has changed
The state of the local Bluetooth adapter has been changed
"Broadcast intent, a hint for applications that audio is about to become 'noisy' due to a change in audio outputs"
Sticky broadcast intent action indicating that the bluetoooth SCO audio connection state has been updated
Sticky broadcast intent action indicating that the ringer mode has changed
Broadcast intent action indicating that the vibrate setting has changed
The setting for background data usage has changed values
A change in network connectivity has occurred. A connection has either been established or lost
Ask the user to add a new device administrator to the system
Have the user enter a new password
Begin the process of encrypting data on the device
Event to launch an audio effect control panel UI
Event to signal to the effect control application or service that an audio session is closed and that effects should not be applied anymore
Event to signal to the effect control application or service that a new audio session is opened and requires audio effects to be applied
Event to start an activity when a tag with NDEF payload is discovered
Event to start an activity when a tag is discovered
Event to start an activity when a tag is discovered and activities are registered for the specific technologies on the tag
Starts the activity from the platform TextToSpeech engine to verify the proper installation and availability of the resource files on the system
Triggers the platform TextToSpeech engine to start the activity that installs the resource files on the device that are required for TTS to be operational
The TextToSpeech synthesizer has completed processing of all the text in the speech queue
Broadcast to signal the completion of the installation of the data files used by the synthesis engine
Event indicating that the state of Wi-Fi p2p connectivity has changed
Event indicating that the available peer list has changed
Event to indicate whether Wi-Fi p2p is enabled or disabled
Event indicating that this device details have changed
Event sent to a device administrator when the user has changed the password of their device
Event periodically sent to a device administrator when the device password is expiring
Event sent to a device administrator when the user has failed at attempted to enter the password
Event sent to a device administrator when the user has successfully entered their password, after failing one or more times
Event sent to a device administrator when the user has disabled it
Event sent to a device administrator when the user has requested to disable it, but before this has actually been done
This is the primary event that a device administrator must implement to be allowed to manage a device
Intent used to broadcast the change in connection state of the A2DP profile
Intent used to broadcast the change in the Playing state of the A2DP profile
Indicates a low level (ACL) connection has been established with a remote device
Indicates a low level (ACL) disconnection from a remote device
Indicates that a low level (ACL) disconnection has been requested for a remote device, and it will soon be disconnected
Indicates a change in the bond state of a remote device. For example, if a device is bonded (paired)
Bluetooth class of a remote device has changed
Indicates the friendly name of a remote device has been retrieved for the first time, or changed since the last retrieval

This intent is used to broadcast the UUID wrapped as a ParcelUuid of the remote device after it has been fetched. This intent is sent only when the UUIDs of the remote device are requested to be fetched using Service Discovery Protocol
Event used to broadcast that the headset has posted a vendor-specific event
Event used to broadcast the change in the Audio Connection state of the A2DP profile
Event used to broadcast the change in connection state of the Headset profile
A new picture is taken by the camera, and the entry of the picture has been added to the media store
A new video is recorded by the camera, and the entry of the video has been added to the media store
Main application icon, disabling this will disable the ability to start the app from launcher
In-App purchase events, disabling will not prevent purchases, app will never know about purchases and maybe become unstable
In-App purchase response code, disabling will not prevent purchases, app will never know about purchases and maybe become unstable
In-App purchase update events, disabling will not prevent purchases, app will never know about purchases and maybe become unstable
"Tracks anonymous application installation to provide developer's installation statistics"
Event received when device has completed its boot sequence
Sent when it is time to update your AppWidget
Sent when it is time to configure your AppWidget while it is being added to a host
Sent when an instance of an AppWidget is deleted from its host
Sent when an instance of an AppWidget is removed from the last host
Sent when an instance of an AppWidget is added to a host for the first time
Send this from your AppWidgetHost activity when you want to pick an AppWidget to display

string-array.name: useful_sysctl_config
string-array.item: vm.dirty_ratio|0|100|5|%|90|This defines the memory cache filling threshold before foreground app data is written to internal memory
vm.dirty_background_ratio|0|100|5|%|70|This defines the memory cache filling threshold before backgroudn app data is written to internal memory
vm.vfs_cache_pressure|10|100|10|%|10|File system cache use ratio versus memory system cache
vm.min_free_kbytes|1024|16384|1024|KB|4096|This is used to force the Linux VM to keep a minimum number of kilobytes free
vm.oom_kill_allocating_task|0|1|1||0|This enables or disables killing the OOM-triggering task in out-of-memory (oom) situations
vm.page-cluster|0|8|1|2^P|3|This controls the number of pages which are written to swap in a single attempt. The swap I/O size is 2^n

vm.panic_on_oom|0|1|1||0|This enables or disables panic on out-of-memory feature. If enabled, the kernel panics when out-of-memory happens. If disabled, the kernel will kill some rogue process, by calling oom_kill()
vm.dirty_expire_centisecs|200|3000|200|100th|1000|How old dirty data should be before the kernel considers it old enough to be written to disk. It is expressed in 100ths of a second
vm.dirty_writeback_centisecs|200|3000|200|100th|2000|This is the interval of when the writeback daemons periodically wake up and write old data out to disk. It is expressed in 100ths of a second
vm.swappiness|10|100|10|%|60|Controls how aggressively the kernel will swap memory pages
kernel.panic|0|30|1|S|10|Set to zero to have the kernel loop on a panic or autoreboot after this number of seconds
kernel.panic_on_oops|0|1|1||1|Disable to have the kernel continue operations after a software failure
kernel.shmall|262144|2097152|262144|P|2097152|Maximum total shared memory pages system wide
fs.nr_open|16384|1048576|16384||1048576|The maximum number of file-handles a process can allocate
fs.inotify.max_queued_events|8000|64000|8000||32000|Events in excess of this limit are dropped, but an IN_Q_OVERFLOW event is always generated
fs.inotify.max_user_instances|64|1024|64||256|This specifies an upper limit on the number of inotify instances that can be created per real user ID
fs.inotify.max_user_watches|640|10240|640||10240|This specifies an upper limit on the number of watches that can be created per real user ID

fs.lease-break-time|5|60|5||10|This specifies the grace period that the kernel grants to a process holding a file lease after it has sent a signal to that process notifying it that another process is waiting to open the file
fs.file-max|16384|1048576|16384||524288|The maximum number of file-handles that the Linux kernel will allocate
kernel.random.write_wakeup_threshold|32|512|32||256|Defines the number of bits of entropy below which we wake up processes that request write access to /dev/random
kernel.random.read_wakeup_threshold|32|512|32||128|Defines the number of bits of entropy required for waking up processes that sleep waiting for entropy from /dev/random. The default is 64
kernel.sched_compat_yield|0|1|1||1|This setting is read at boot time, enabling it improve performance on multi-core devices
kernel.msgmni|512|8192|512||2048|Defines the system-wide limit on the number of message queue identifiers
kernel.msgmax|32768|524288|32768||65536|Defines a system-wide limit specifying the maximum number of bytes in a single message written on a message queue
kernel.shmmni|1024|16384|1024||4096|Specifies the system-wide maximum number of shared memory segments that can be created
kernel.sem|||||500 512000 64 2048|4 numbers defining limits for semaphores: per set, system-wide, operations, identifiers
kernel.hung_task_timeout_secs|0|60|5|S|30|Timeout in seconds for hanged tasks. Set to 0 to disable but can cause black screen on incoming calls
kernel.sched_child_runs_first|0|1|1||0|Enable to have a child process scheduled next after being launched by its parent (default)
vm.drop_caches|0|3|1||3|Causes the kernel to drop clean caches, dentries and inodes from memory, causing that memory to become free
vm.min_free_order_shift|1|5|1||4|The higher the value, the more frequent unused objects will be released, freeing memory
net.core.wmem_max|65536|4194304|65536|B|524288|Maximal amount of memory allowed for automatically tuned send buffers over TCP
net.core.rmem_max|65536|4194304|65536|B|524288|Maximal amount of memory allowed for automatically tuned receive buffers over TCP
net.ipv4.tcp_tw_recycle|0|1|1||1|Enable fast recycling TIME-WAIT sockets, default is disabled
net.ipv4.tcp_rmem|||||6144 87380 524288|Minimum, default and maximum amount of memory reserved for receive buffers over TCP
net.ipv4.tcp_wmem|||||6144 87380 524288|Minimum, default and maximum amount of memory reserved for send buffers over TCP
